byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden and Liz Alderman reported from Paris, and Katrin Bennhold from London. Reporting was contributed by Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Paris; Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura, James Kanter and Milan Schreuer from Brussels; Eric Schmitt from Washington; Alison Smale from Berlin; and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.
byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN, LIZ ALDERMAN and KATRIN BENNHOLD

abstract: French police raid apartment in northern Paris suburb of St-Denis with hopes of capturing at least two fugitives suspected in terrorist attacks that killed 129 people; raid erupts in gunfire, and at least one person dies after detonating suicide vest; several are arrested.
lead_paragraph: The police stormed the northern Paris suburb of St.-Denis early Wednesday morning in a raid evidently aimed at capturing at least two fugitives.

headline.main: Heavy Gunfire Erupts as French Police Seek Suspects in Raid
headline.print_headline: Raid Near Paris Erupts in Gunfire as Police Move In

snippet: The police stormed the northern Paris suburb of St.-Denis early Wednesday morning in a raid evidently aimed at capturing at least two fugitives.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
